result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey J. Tschan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Theft by Acquisition of a Credit Card, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
30 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation
Concurrent with: 22CF178 & 21CF1161

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey J. Tschan

records.addlTxt:
3:52 PM Cases called: 21CF576, 21CF1161, 22CF178 & 22CF195 Defendant Corey J. Tschan appeared in custody via video from the Eau Claire County Jail, Attorney Robert Allen Thorson for Corey J. Tschan appeared in court, Attorney Peter J. Rindal for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. There is an agreement. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant waives right to appear in person. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to:

Count 1 in 21CF576: Possession of  Methamphetamine
Count 1 in 21CF1161: Identity Theft Avoidance
Count 2 in 21CF1161: Identity Theft Financial Gain
Count 4 in 21CF1161: Resisting an Officer
Count 1 in 22CF178: Escape
Count 3 in 22CF178: Possession of Cocaine
Count 4 in 22CF178: Felony Bail Jumping
Count 7 in 22CF178: Misd Carry Concealed Knife
Count 1 in 22CF195: Felony Bail Jumping
count 3 in 22CF195: Misd Theft of Credit Card

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders on:

Count 1 in 21CF1161: Identity Theft Avoidance
Count 2 in 21CF1161: Identity Theft Financial Gain
Count 1 in 22CF178: Escape
Count 1 in 22CF195: Felony Bail Jumping
Count 3 in 22CF195: Misd Theft of Credit Card

3 years Probation sentence withheld on each count concurrent with conditions. Count 3 in 22CF195 is only 1 year Probation.

Conditions of Probation:
120 days jail with Huber on Count 1 in 21CF1161 - all stayed pending further order of the court.
No contact with any RCU locations
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
No contact with M.V., J.M., T.R., T.L., or M.M. 
Restitution = $673.26 in 21CF1161 plus the 10% and 5% surcharges. 60 days allowed for further restitution requests to be submitted. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Court costs

Remaining Counts have court costs ordered. 2 warrant fees in 21CF576 will be assessed in addition to costs.

Jail credit if revoked from Probation: 
36 days in 22CF178
30 days 22CF195
41 days 21CF1161

Any other counts in these cases are ordered dismissed and read in.

9:49 AM Cases called: 22CF195, 21CF576, 21CF1161 & 22CF178. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Corey J. Tschan appeared by video, in custody, from the Eau Claire County Jail, Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared in court for Corey J. Tschan. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in all 4 cases and Court accepts waiver. There is an agreement. The cases will be set for a felony plea in Br 2.
Plea hearing on March 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: 11:04 AM case called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Corey J. Tschan appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Zebulon Patek from the Eau Claire Jail. Waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 2-23-22 at 1:30 PM. Return to court: 3-7-22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions: 
No contact with T.L. or her residence.
No contact with M.M. , T.W. or RCU locations. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services if released.
(Covers 21CF576, 21CF1161, 22CF178, 22CF195)
